utterances.sentences: All right. So, the mainstream media took a major hit to their already dwindling credibility and when they refused to go wall-to-wall covering the now debunk BuzzFeed report, in case you missed it, here is some of the despicable coverage. Take a look.

utterances.sentences: None of the women here care about that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Do you condemn those anti-Semitic statements?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Do you condemn Tamika Mallory and Linda Sarsour?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Interesting outfits. Fox News contributor Sara Carter joins us now along with Fox News contributor Tammy Bruce. Now, you were there in one capacity.

utterances.speaker: TAMMY BRUCE, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Sara, we'll start with you because you were interviewing the people at that particular march. They didn't seem to care a lot of them about real radical anti-Semitism. utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: I think it was shocking, Sean, for me. It was really disturbing that a lot of the people that I spoke with didn't just take a step back and say, "Absolutely. We condemn it." It's completely anti-Semitic. I brought out the statements that were made by Louis Farrakhan. I asked them directly, "Do you condemn these statements?" Some of them didn't even know what was going on the week prior. They didn't even understand what the controversy was about. Others just wanted to stay away from altogether. And some - some, on the other hand, did say they did not condone it. They did condemn it and that they were showing up anyways because this was part of their cause, this is something that they wanted to be a part of.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes. Mallory, one of the organizers--

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Despite the leadership--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: --referred to Farrakhan as the greatest ever. At least, probably the biggest anti-Semite in the entire country. Let's go to Linda Sarsour--

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: --another organizer. She is known to praise and support sharia law. She said - remember, Ayaan Hirsi Ali, who was a victim of female genital mutilation, a victim. She said she doesn't deserve to be a woman - a woman deserves to have her female anatomy taken away. And then when she's confronted about it, she blamed the Jewish media. It doesn't get any more anti-woman--

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: --than that or anti-Semitic and racist than that.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Ayaan's personal experience, of course, is extensive. And this is - she was being condemned because she was speaking honestly about the problems with radical Islam and that if you care about women, that's something that we all have to be able to be honest about. utterances.sentences: Maybe a part of it is Winston Churchill issue. If you're 20 and not a liberal, you don't have a heart; 40 and conservative, you don't have a brain.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: But - but what I think Sara's report showed us was that there is no information flowing into those individuals, even immediate news from the week before, let alone historical answers, about how women have gotten here, what we're facing now, what we've overcome, the things that unite us, that's what the focus can be. It's--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: How did your--

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: --who we are now in the 21st century.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: How did your - you got a counter-portal (ph).

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: How did that go?

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.sentences: Yes, that's right. Independent Women's Voice, it was great. I mean, our message was, look, there are problems that we've got to overcome. But it's the 21st century and it's time to come together. Right? The argument and this rhetoric about dividing us and that there is an enemy and that everything is - you know, you've got to go after people who want to put you into a camp or their - it's the handmaid's tale. That's archaic. And it's also not true. Our message was, coming together is what makes the difference.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Sara, how do you go to a Women's March when you have one of the organizers that support sharia, which abuses women, kills gays and lesbians, and persecutes Christians and Jews in many of these countries?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Well, the American people and especially our youth are being disenfranchised by journalism today. They're not hearing the truth. They're not having access to the truth. We really need to start educating ourselves, Sean. And the anti-Semitic behavior of both Tamika Mallory and Linda Sarsour is incredible. People should understand that. And unfortunately, a lot of young people went and marched, and they had no idea what was going on with their leadership that day. And that's truly unfortunate.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Real quickly - real quickly--

utterances.speaker: BRUCE

Three years of legislative relief for 700,000 DACA recipients brought here unlawfully by their parents at a young age many years ago.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So the president is trying to do his job. Honest efforts reaching out to the Democratic Party every possible way. An invitation a day they won't meet him. They are too busy traveling on paid junkets and using taxpayer money. And once again, they want to score cheap political points. I thought they cared about the furloughed workers. Apparently not. I guess they cared about the DACA kids, apparently not. And Dreamers, apparently not. The president tweeted, quote Nancy Pelosi, some of the Democrats turned down my latest offer yesterday before I even got up to speak. They don't see crime and drugs. They only see 2020, meaning an election year which they are not going to win. Best economy. They should do the right thing for the country. Allow people to go back to work. And secure the borders. And while Democrats dig in and obstruct, even some in the hate Trump media, they are beginning to admit that the president is making Speaker Pelosi and the Democrats look pretty stupid. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: They were in the bus heading to Joint Base Andrews. He made them look like fools coming back sitting there at the capitol in the driveway there basically trying to figure out what's coming next. He caught them in the act as if they were sneaking out of town and made them look stupid. I mean, clearly what it looked like a political dirty trick to me.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Now, maybe they should stay and take the president's invitation and sit down at a table oh when they had a chance to sit with the vice president weeks ago on a weekend, they sent their aides. They were too busy. Unfortunately, the cost of an unsecure border growing more deadly every day. As have you seen right here on this program, Nancy Pelosi wouldn't meet with them last week. We have talked to Angel moms and dads who have lost loved ones to illegal immigrant crime. And now, tonight, we are learning that a suspected illegal immigrant was arrested this weekend in connection with a string of brutal murders this time in Reno, Nevada. Now, authorities say they have evidence connecting 19-year-old Wilbur Ernesto Martinez Guzman (ph) to all four homicides and that, quote: he is likely in the United States and was detainable. Border security is not a manufactured crisis. It is a reality. It's time for Democrats to stop the Trump hate, do their jobs, stop the political ploys and the lies. Fund the border, which they supported four years ago, get the wall built that they supported four years ago. Go to the table, sit down. Accept the president's invitation. Negotiate. In other words, it's time for them to roll up their sleeves and do their jobs. Maybe they don't get another paid junket to a luxury resort in a chartered plane with a big carbon footprint. Up next, we have a panel reacting to my opening monologue. Also, Sara Carter was at the Women's March in Washington, D/.C. this past weekend. Our cameras were there asking them about the anti-Semitic scandal surrounding two of the group's leaders. Their answers will shock you. Also later tonight, we tell you about a new segment you don't want to miss. Hannity Watch, vetting the 2020 Democrats. Something you will get nowhere else on TV or in the media, straight ahead.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. So, the mainstream media took a major hit to their already dwindling credibility and when they refused to go wall-to-wall covering the now debunk BuzzFeed report, in case you missed it, here is some of the despicable coverage. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Still no reaction from President Trump to report that ties him directly to the very same offense for which the House of Representatives moved to impeach Richard Nixon.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: That as appears -- if true, he would be guilty of suborning perjury, potentially obstruction of justice.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: This report is a huge deal. And, you know, these are very credible reporters. We are deep in the realm now of credibly impeachable offenses.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: There are an awful lot of similarities between a couple of articles of impeachment against Nixon and the elements of this story.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I see him going to a corner. I see him scratching back like a cornered animal. I think he is afraid.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Joining us, former Secret Service agent, host of "The Dan Bongino Show" and podcast, author of the latest bestselling book, "Relatable Podcast" host Allie Beth Stuckey is with us, and former Michigan U.S. Senate candidate John James. Dan, I start with you. Look, if I can I will tell my friends in the control room -- start scrolling again the fake news. This has happened.  Literally I printed out from 2017 alone the fake news stories about Donald Trump that they breathlessly report that that turn out to be false was 47 kind of small print, printed pages.

utterances.speaker: DAN BONGINO, FORMER SECRET SERVICE AGENT
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That is a track record of people that have an agenda to destroy not to the truth.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Sean, journalism is dead. It's buried. It's gone. It gives me no pleasure in telling you that but I warn everybody out there in America right now in your search for truth, relying on journalists is a fool's errand. They are leading you down the wrong path. It's now clear as day. Sean, what you said is accurate, too, but it's not just that there are 40- plus stories. I can see them out of the corner of my eye scrolling on the screen now. It's not just that, Sean, it's that these were major stories they got wrong, Sean. It wasn't like Donald Trump ordered McDonald's when it was really Burger King. The dossier story in and of itself was debunked. The Deutsch Bank story about Donald Trump's bank record. The WikiLeaks story with Don Trump Jr., debunked. The story last week, Manafort gave polling data to the Russians, I mean, I don't want to take up those, I could go on all day you get the point.  These were major stories they got wrong. You are completely on your own, America, in your search for truth right now gives me no pleasure in saying that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Allie, get your take on the whole issue. It's what they want.  It's what they have been telling their audiences now for two straight years. And it's also what they don't report about oh, how top officials exonerated Hillary when she should have been charged with a crime obstruction and the Espionage Act and all the FISA abuse and all the people that signed on after being warned by Bruce Ohr, that it's phony. She paid for it not to be trusted it's never been verified or corroborated, but became the basis of four FISA warrants. They don't touch that story. ALLIE BETH STUCKEY, "RELATABLE" PODCAST HOST: No. That's because they don't see themselves as truth tellers. They seem themselves as vigilantes.  So, they are on a mission to accomplish something, and that is push a particular narrative. The narrative right now happens to be that make sure Donald Trump gets impeached. So, anything that they hear that falls into that preconceived notion of how they think that the world should be, they report on, whether or not reality actually lines up with that. So, they start with a forgone conclusion and then they try to fit in the pieces that fit into that. They leave out the piece that don't fit into that conclusion, rather than looking at the facts of the story and coming up with a conclusion or better yet letting the American people come up with their own conclusion. No, they see themselves as heroes. It has nothing to do with the truth and everything to do with their own biased mission.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You know, John James, I watched your campaign very closely. I watched you, you were down at one point I think by 30 points -- you're closing that gap. Closing that gap. And your story is so compelling and so amazing that I felt - my opinion as an outsider - we loved having you on radio and TV. I felt they were purposefully under-reporting the great story of success that you have had in your life, as they didn't want you to win. Am I right or am I wrong?

utterances.speaker: JOHN JAMES, FORMER U.S. SENATE CANDIDATE FOR MICHIGAN
utterances.utterance: Well, I believe that my story is a story of so many people who've immigrated from all over the world and from all over the country to have better experience and better opportunity. And I love what Allie just said about vigilantism. Vigilantism is just a form of a mob mentality. And I believe that due process and truth is under attack in this country. I fought in my military career as a West Point graduate, as an army captain flying 750 hours, combating Operation Iraqi Freedom because I love this constitution, I love this country. The First Amendment is under attack. When you can have malicious insinuation tearing down the journalistic integrity that we rely so much on, and it's going to result in someone getting badly hurt. We need to make sure that we are acting with integrity and we're holding the people who tell us these stories accountable because you can't believe the storytellers anymore. We have to think for ourselves. And that's what I've talked about is not just believing what we're being fed but by thinking critically and by holding journalists accountable.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Dan, on this program, I could start with Richard Jewell, then I can talk about the vetting of Obama.

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We were pretty much alone in doing that. I could talk about the Duke lacrosse case. I took the time to meet the families and the kids those who would meet with me. I went down and interviewed George Zimmerman. I didn't rush to judgment as the President did. Cambridge Police; Ferguson, Missouri; UVA; Baltimore, Maryland; and Obama's horrible record after eight years. It's amazing what they missed, why would they miss, even the deep-dive we've done into the deep state and real corruption and abuse of power at the top levels of the DOJ and the FBI. Why wouldn't they care about that story if they are in the media and say they're journalists?

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. Sean, with the Covington kids this weekend, think about this. This could be you. This could be anyone. This could be your brother, your sister, your kids. These kids were at a rally in D.C., at a pro-life rally, and they fit every box the media can't stand. They were at a pro-life rally. They had MAGA hats on. They were young kids that went to a Christian school. And Sean, in the blink of an eye, in a snap of a finger, just like that, these kids' lives forever will be marked on the Internet by a - by vigilante, what they call media justice, where they jumped in, did no background or research on this case at all and ruined their lives. They can ruin your future--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Why wouldn't they have gone after--

utterances.speaker: BONGINO
utterances.utterance: --they can ruin your job.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Allie, why wouldn't they have gone after the Hebrew Israelites that hate everybody? And what they said to the kids is we had the tapes. They started it all.

utterances.speaker: STUCKEY
utterances.utterance: Right. The crime that they committed was not what they did but the hat that they were wearing. That's the only crime that they actually committed and the media knows that.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Last word. John James?

utterances.speaker: JAMES
utterances.utterance: The day before MLK Day, I wonder how many people will completely find attacking 16-year-olds who are minding their own business but then tweeted a post about Martin Luther King. People need to look at themselves in the mirror and look at not just discriminating these people but - because of how they think.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Prediction, they're not going to change at all. And they'll be breathless and hysterical in the next Trump story that think they got people. Sad, but it's also dangerous. Thank you all. When we come back, we sent Sara Carter to the Women's March this weekend in Washington, D.C. You will not believe what the people there said when Sara asked them about the anti-semitic scandal surrounding the group's founders. We'll play you the tape. And also tonight, a new Hannity Watch segment, we begin vetting the 2020 Democratic candidates. This, I promise you, is going to be fun over time. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right. The Women's March that we warned you about last week, well, it happened this past weekend. And we sent Fox News contributor Sara Carter to the march in Washington, D.C. where the anti-Semitism scandal has been rocking the march organizers. And Sara asked some of the people at the march about the controversy and here's what they told her.

utterances.speaker: SARA CARTER, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Tamika Mallory and Linda Sarsour who organized this event have been highly criticized for anti-Semitic statements and also for the fact that Tamika Mallory would not condemn Louis Farrakhan's statement about the Jewish people in the State of Israel. How do you reconcile their apparent hate speech by Louis Farrakhan and their failure to condemn it and then being here today?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: One woman doesn't represent all women. She doesn't stand for the entire movement.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Irrelevant to the cause.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: None of the women here care about that.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Some mistakes within the leadership don't define the whole movement, and the movement as a whole still has a lot of good points and there's still a lot of work to be done.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: Do you condemn those anti-Semitic statements?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Of course. Of course. 100 percent. Of course, of course. And I would say that you would find everybody here that that would be true for everyone.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: As someone who's Jewish, I'll say that us showing up isn't in support of those anti-Semitic. I'm -- they're not (ph) even in support of those leaders. It's in support of ourselves.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: Do you condemn Tamika Mallory and Linda Sarsour?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: No, absolutely not. Absolutely not. They're the leaders of this movement. And I think the leaders of this movement are looking to reach goals. And they have to do what they have to do to reach their goals.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: I think the Women's March is larger than those two individuals. I think - they do not speak for all the women here.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: No one said anything today anti-semitic. So we're working with today, the here, the now, the present.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: It's better to be a bad feminist than no feminist at all. So I think that it's important that even though one person does something wrong that we still come here and we show up addition we represent what we want to see in our government.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Interesting outfits. Fox News contributor Sara Carter joins us now along with Fox News contributor Tammy Bruce. Now, you were there in one capacity.

utterances.speaker: TAMMY BRUCE, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Sara, we'll start with you because you were interviewing the people at that particular march. They didn't seem to care a lot of them about real radical anti-Semitism. And you also mentioned the things that they had said. What else did you glean out of this experience that we sent you through?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: I think it was shocking, Sean, for me. It was really disturbing that a lot of the people that I spoke with didn't just take a step back and say, "Absolutely. We condemn it." It's completely anti-Semitic. I brought out the statements that were made by Louis Farrakhan. I asked them directly, "Do you condemn these statements?" And so many people had such a difficult time actually saying that they condemned the statements. And that was what was really disturbing. On the other hand, there were a lot of young people marching. Some of them didn't even know what was going on the week prior. They didn't even understand what the controversy was about. Others just wanted to stay away from altogether. And some - some, on the other hand, did say they did not condone it. They did condemn it and that they were showing up anyways because this was part of their cause, this is something that they wanted to be a part of.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes. Mallory, one of the organizers--

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: Despite the leadership--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --referred to Farrakhan as the greatest ever. At least, probably the biggest anti-Semite in the entire country. Let's go to Linda Sarsour--

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --another organizer. She is known to praise and support sharia law. She said - remember, Ayaan Hirsi Ali, who was a victim of female genital mutilation, a victim. She said she doesn't deserve to be a woman - a woman deserves to have her female anatomy taken away. And then when she's confronted about it, she blamed the Jewish media. It doesn't get any more anti-woman--

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --than that or anti-Semitic and racist than that.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: Ayaan's personal experience, of course, is extensive. And this is - she was being condemned because she was speaking honestly about the problems with radical Islam and that if you care about women, that's something that we all have to be able to be honest about. But what's interesting certainly about the march - and this speaks to I think also the American sensibility. Americans want to go out and have an impact. That's clear. Young people, it's - I was doing it, of course. It's a wonderful exciting thing to do. You want to make a difference. The problem is, is that they are being used by a fraud, that they're being used by people who say, "Oh, we understand this. We agree with you. Here's what we're going to be doing." And it becomes when they will look back, as I have done to some degree with my leftist activism, is you think about the time that was wasted, you think about the grifters, you think about the fraud, and--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Maybe a part of it is Winston Churchill issue. If you're 20 and not a liberal, you don't have a heart; 40 and conservative, you don't have a brain.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: But - but what I think Sara's report showed us was that there is no information flowing into those individuals, even immediate news from the week before, let alone historical answers, about how women have gotten here, what we're facing now, what we've overcome, the things that unite us, that's what the focus can be. It's--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: How did your--

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: --who we are now in the 21st century.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: How did your - you got a counter-portal (ph).

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: How did that go?

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's right. Independent Women's Voice, it was great. I mean, our message was, look, there are problems that we've got to overcome. But it's the 21st century and it's time to come together. Right? The argument and this rhetoric about dividing us and that there is an enemy and that everything is - you know, you've got to go after people who want to put you into a camp or their - it's the handmaid's tale. That's archaic. And it's also not true. Our message was, coming together is what makes the difference.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Sara, how do you go to a Women's March when you have one of the organizers that support sharia, which abuses women, kills gays and lesbians, and persecutes Christians and Jews in many of these countries?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: Well, the American people and especially our youth are being disenfranchised by journalism today. They're not hearing the truth. They're not having access to the truth. We really need to start educating ourselves, Sean. And the anti-Semitic behavior of both Tamika Mallory and Linda Sarsour is incredible. People should understand that. And unfortunately, a lot of young people went and marched, and they had no idea what was going on with their leadership that day. And that's truly unfortunate.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Real quickly - real quickly--

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: My quick addition is that the liberals who went by our march, our rally, were nice. They recognized we were nice. They liked our signs. They expressed dismay of hostility that was happening across the street. And the thing for conservatives to remember, be out there, meet people, don't let them isolate you.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: If I go out there, I'm going to be--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --do you really want to hang out with me if I'm out there?

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: Maybe not--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you want to hang out with--

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: Not on the subway, but we should--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Oh, OK.

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: --talk to people.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: I will, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I'm an army of security and--

utterances.speaker: BRUCE
utterances.utterance: All three of us.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: --and every one of our martial arts partners. All right. Good to see you. When we come back, you don't want to miss our next segment. We're going to do something the mainstream media, I promise, is never going to do. We are beginning our vetting. It's a process. Hannity Watch, the 2020 Democratic candidates. We'll begin day one next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Time now for a new Hannity Watch segment. And that is the vetting of the 2020 radical Democratic candidates. Like we have been telling you, a new radical wing has now taken over the Democratic Party, pushing an agenda of open borders, higher taxes, more government control of your life. And today, California Senator Kamala Harris became the latest to enter that 2020 race. And while our campaign kickoff focused on so-called unity and justice, bumper stickers, platitudes, her comments as a sitting senator have been some of the most despicable in Washington, like when she compared brave border patrol and ICE people to the KKK. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: The clan was, what we would call today, a domestic terrorist group.

utterances.speaker: SEN. KAMALA HARRIS, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: Why? Why would we call them domestic terrorist group?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: Because they tried to use fear and force to change political environment.

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: Are you aware of the perception of many about how the power and the discretion at ICE is being used to enforce the laws? And do you see any parallels? ELLEN DEGENERES, HOST, THE "ELLEN" SHOW: If you had to be stuck in an elevator with either President Trump, Mike Pence or Jeff Sessions, who would it be?

utterances.speaker: HARRIS
utterances.utterance: Does one of us have to come out alive?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: It gets far worse. Remember when she got busted for releasing deceptively edited video to smear Justice Kavanaugh and push the anti- catholic bigotry by grilling one of President Trump's judicial nominees over belonging to the knights of Columbus? How is this in any way unified? How is this good for the country? And it's not just criticism from the right. Harris is even facing opposition for not being progressive enough. But Senator Harris isn't the only troubling Democratic candidate. New York Senator Kirsten Gillibrand literally staking out her socialist agenda to try and win loyalty from the base of the far left Democratic Party. Now Gillibrand appears to be learning from her mentor, Hillary Clinton, about the power of flipping and flopping to try and win votes. For example, this week she told the New York Daily News she now favors giving illegal immigrants' drivers' licenses, after coming out against that in 2007. And during an interview on ABC on Sunday, she was pressed about her stark shift on immigration, but offered few specifics for the change. Now like I've been saying, this is all going to get much crazier. We're going to give you a front row seat. It will be entertaining. Here with reaction former Florida Attorney General Pam Bondi, Fox News contributor Rachel Campos-Duffy. Pam, I'll start with you. Reaction. There's a part of me that's - I - I'll do the job the media won't do. Glad to have it.

utterances.speaker: PAM BONDI, FORMER FLORIDA ATTORNEY GENERAL
utterances.utterance: And Sean, first of all, the more the merrier, I think, in all of these Democrats getting in this election because Donald Trump has been completely consistent with everything he has done. Lowering taxes, protecting our veterans, securing our borders, everything he's been consistent with. Our GDP is great. Unemployment rate. Yet, now we have Kamala Harris who - and I've worked with her as Attorney General. And she was tough on crime. I knew she believed in our border patrol. And now - they're all getting pushed so far to the left, even slightly using the words ICE and KKK in the same sentence, it's just - it's - it's sad. It's unfair. And these men and women are out there risking their lives every single day. Then you've got Gillibrand who comes in, who had supported ICE all along, and now she is saying calling them inhumane. These men and women who are on our borders protecting us every day. So--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Well--

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: The more the merrier, bring it on, in my opinion, because they are being inconsistent. And I think more inconsistencies are going to come out every single day.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Rachel?

utterances.speaker: RACHEL CAMPOS-DUFFY, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Listen, Alexandria Cortez has moved everybody further and further to the left. This is when they started to take off their masks and show their true colors. In the case of Kamala, look, she's playing the primary game very well because this is who she really is. She's a woman from Berkeley. She's a radical leftist. And I think that she will play well. She checks a lot of boxes. And the Democrat primary will be about checking as many identity politics boxes that you can in this sweepstakes for victimhood that they have.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. So - if 2018--

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: I think she'll play well with - in the primary.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: 2018 was about hiding who they are. 2020 is going to be about showing how extreme left you are. Right?

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Yes. Right. It is. And again, the further left they go, the less credibility any of them are going to have with the American people in the time in which we live. Look at the world in which we live. Our children, our security, our country, that's what's important. Our military, our great men and women in uniform who fight for us every single day. And the further they push against them, the more it's going to hurt them as candidates because President Trump supports all of them.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Last word, Rachel?

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Our military.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: Listen, it's going to be harder for them to move towards the center. But in the end, I think that the American people are - in the Midwest where the Democrats have failed to make any messages or make any inroads because they're so focused on China and on Russia and hating Trump, I think that this is actually good news--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We'll see.

utterances.speaker: CAMPOS-DUFFY
utterances.utterance: --for Trump in 2020.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Agree with both of you. All right. When we come back, Friday, I asked you which network you thought was the most biased. Your answers next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. On Friday, I asked you to tweet or go to Facebook, #hatetrumpmedia about who you thought was the most corrupt in the media. You have responded. Here are some of your answers. We're going to be reading them all week. One of you tweeting, "CNN. They're quick to discuss anything perceived as anti-Trump, twisting and distorting it. Then when the truth is revealed, they can't - don't recant it. And recent example is BuzzFeed and that fiasco. I have no faith in the validity of their reporting." Another tweet, "I think they are all ignorant. I refuse to watch them." OK. Send in your tweets, Facebook, Hannity.com, and we will be putting them up on the week - on the screen all week. And we're going to deputize you this week, something I have to announce. Let not your heart be troubled. The news continues. Content and Programming Copyright 2019 Fox News Network, LLC.
